articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Acquaints Himself with Work in Ryanggang Province
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Acquaints Himself with Work in Ryanggang Province
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Choe Yong Rim acquainted himself with the economic work in Ryanggang Province on the spot from June 2 to 4. 
					 While going round various production units including the Hyesan Steel Works, the Hyesan Footwear Factory, the Samjiyon Vegetable Greenhouse, the Paektusan Youth Cranberry Establishment, the Taehongdan Potato Processing Factory, a farm in Tokpho area, Paekam County, and commercial and public catering establishments, he learned in detail about production, technological updating and management.
					
					 He at a consultative meeting of officials in the field concerned took technical measures to tap and use at the maximum raw materials in the alpine region at the local industrial factories and profitably manage and operate them, expand in a big way the area of the fields under potato and reenergize the economic work in the province as intended by the party. 
					
					 On June 3 he visited the construction site of the Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station and took measures to boost the electricity production at its Power Station No.1 which was commissioned ahead of schedule and accelerate the dam construction project.

articles.title: Kim Yong Dae Meets Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Dae Meets Vietnamese Delegation
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with the friendly delegation of Vietnam headed by Pham Tat Dong, chairman of the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Association, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.

articles.title: Friendly Gathering with Members of Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Friendly Gathering with Members of Vietnamese Delegation 
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- A friendly gathering with members of the friendly delegation of Vietnam was held at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Tuesday.
					 Present there on invitation were the Vietnamese delegation led by Pham Tat Dong, chairman of the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Association, and Le Quang Ba, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairman of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Association, and teachers and children of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Kyongsang Kindergarten were on hand.
					
					 The participants enjoyed an art performance given by children.

articles.title: Agreement between DPRK, Vietnamese Kindergartens Inked
articles.content:
Agreement between DPRK, Vietnamese Kindergartens Inked
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- An agreement on exchange and cooperation between the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Kyongsang Kindergarten and the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Kindergarten was signed in Pyongyang on Tuesday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairman of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Association, and officials concerned and from the opposite side the Vietnamese friendly delegation headed by Pham Tat Dong, chairman of the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Association, and Le Quang Ba, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Hwanggumphyong and Wihwa Islands Economic Zone to Be Set Up
articles.content:
Hwanggumphyong and Wihwa Islands Economic Zone to Be Set Up 
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The Japanese Tokyo Shimbun Tuesday released the following report titled "Close to setting up economic zone on DPRK-China border:" 
					 The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK Monday promulgated a decree on setting up the Hwanggumphyong and Wihwa Islands Economic Zone in the border with China.  It was reported that the sovereignty of the DPRK would be exercised in the zone and the development of the zone would start from the Hwanggumphyong district.
					
					 Both Hwanggumphyong and Wihwa Islands are within the territory of the DPRK along the River Amnok flowing along the DPRK-China border. It was basically agreed to develop Hwanggumphyong by the joint efforts of the DPRK and China. A ground-breaking ceremony is expected to take place within one or two days.
					
					 The project for building the DPRK-China Amnokgang Bridge which started at the end of last year is making brisk headway on the river. It seems that a discussion on the above-said zone was held during the China visit by General Secretary Kim Jong Il in May and it is likely to put greater impetus to economic cooperation between the DPRK and China and development of the border area with the decision as an occasion.
					
					 The SPA Presidium of the DPRK, explaining the reason for setting up the economic zone, said it was to boost the traditional DPRK-China friendship and expand and develop external economic relations.
					
					 South Korean CBS released similar news on the same day.

articles.title: DPRK People Vow Revenge on S. Korean Regime
articles.content:
DPRK People Vow Revenge on S. Korean Regime
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- After the release of the statement of the spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, people of various social strata in the DPRK have resolved to take revenge on the Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea for its abuses of the DPRK's supreme dignity.
					 A general of the KPA, Kim Chol, told KCNA that the army will launch a substantial and overall military reprisal on the south Korean regime of traitors and escalate it till it took measures to punish those mainly responsible for the abuses and make an apology. 
					
					 Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, said the young people of the DPRK are determined to become human bullets and bombs to guard the leadership of the revolution and wipe out the traitors.
					
					 The manager of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, Ri Hi Hon, said that when an opportunity presents itself, the red guardsmen of the complex will take the lead in annihilating the enemies and blow up the headquarters of confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, said all its members are ready to eliminate the foes of the nation with a rifle in one hand and a sickle in the other.
					
					 Kim Wan Su, director of the Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea, appealed to all the Korean people in the north, south and abroad to turn out in a nationwide struggle for shattering the traitors' heinous anti-DPRK confrontation moves.

articles.title: University of Education in Pyongyang to Be Renovated
articles.content:
University of Education in Pyongyang to Be Renovated
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- A ground-breaking ceremony was held on Monday to renovate Kim Hyong Jik University of Education in Pyongyang.
					 New modern buildings and library will be constructed and the existing buildings, gymnasium and house of culture renovated.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kang Nung Su, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Ryang Man Gil, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, officers and men of the Korean People's Army, officials concerned and teaching staff and students of the university.
					
					 Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Education Commission, made a report there which was followed by speeches.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Observed
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place at the People's Palace of Culture Tuesday to mark the 50th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's work "Public Health Workers Should Be Red Champions of the Party."
					 The work, published on June 7, 1961, clarifies the detailed tasks and ways for improving the health service. Expounded in it are such matters as intensifying the ideological remolding among the health workers so that they can devotedly serve for the promotion of people's health and making them play the role of agitating and educating in the Party's policy.
					
					 Present there were Department Director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea Choe Hui Jong, officials concerned and medical workers in Pyongyang.
					
					 Prior to the meeting the participants heard the recorded speech "Public Health Workers Should Be Red Champions of the Party" made by the President at the national meeting of activists of public health service.
					
					 Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health, said in a report at the meeting that the President in the work gave a scientific exposition of theoretical and practical problems arising in fully displaying the advantages of the socialist health system.
					
					 The work is important guidelines that should be always held fast to in bringing about a radical turn in the ideological and moral traits of medical workers and developing the Juche-based health service, the reporter said, 
					
					 Recalling that the President wisely led the drive to develop the health service, the reporter said that his feats for the development of the health service are shining more brilliantly thanks to the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The reporter called on all the health workers of the country to bring about a fresh radical turn in the public health service and thus greatly contribute to improving the people's living standard and building a thriving nation.

articles.title: World Environment Day Observed
articles.content:
World Environment Day Observed 
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Events took place in Pyongyang to mark World Environment Day.
					 Present at an event held at the People's Palace of Culture Monday were officials of the Ministry of Land and Environment Conservation and other ministries and national institutions, the visiting delegation of the United Nations Environment Program and members of missions of international organizations and cooperation missions working in the DPRK.
					
					 Addressing it were Kim Song Hak, vice-minister of Land and Environment Conservation, and Christian Marx, head of the UNEP delegation.
					
					 They noted that the UNEP set "Forests: Nature at Your Service" as theme for World Environment Day this year.
					
					 Forests have an important role to play in environmental protection, they said, stressing the need to strive to protect forests and raise the public interest in this work.
					
					 Then there were speeches calling for decisively improving the forest management as required by the new century.
					
					 On the same day, a fine art and writing exhibition of schoolchildren from across the country took place at the Pyongyang Students and Children's Palace.
					
					 Present were officials of the Education Commission and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned, schoolchildren from each province who presented excellent works and members of the visiting UNEP delegation and missions of international organizations here.
					
					 After speeches were made, the participants looked round more than 50 fine art works and 40 odd literary works on the subject of environment.
					
					 A national schoolchildren's quiz on environment was held at the Pyongyang Students and Children's Palace Tuesday on the same occasion.

articles.title: Geothermal Water Resources Harnessed
articles.content:
Geothermal Water Resources Harnessed
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Projects for harnessing geothermal water resources have been carried on in economic sectors of the DPRK.
					 The Ryongsong Machine Complex developed new geothermal equipment for ensuring heating and cooling of buildings. 
					
					 The new equipment raises thermal efficiency much higher with less electricity than the existing equipment.
					
					 The Huichon Ryonha General Machine Factory introduced an air-conditioning system based on underground water, while the South Hamgyong Provincial Prospecting Bureau applied the same system to greenhouses.
					
					 The Jongbangsan Combined Foodstuff Factory and some other industrial establishments are working on using geothermal water to keep a proper temperature in production facilities.

articles.title: DPRK to Compete in World Cups
articles.content:
DPRK to Compete in World Cups
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The DPRK will participate in the Women's World Cup, U-20 World Cup and U-17 World Cup this year.
					 The DPRK women's team, which won the Asian championship three times in the new century, belongs to Group C together with Sweden, Colombia and the United States.
					
					 The Korean boys won U-19 and U-16 Asian Cups last year.
					
					 They will compete with Argentina, Mexico and England in U-20 group league matches and with Mexico, the Netherlands and Congo in U-17 group league matches.
					
					 The Korean boys and girls are now undergoing intensive training for the world cups.

articles.title: Medicinal Effect of Bean Sprouts
articles.content:
Medicinal Effect of Bean Sprouts
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- More medical properties of bean sprouts have been discovered.
					 The results of a recent research show that bean sprout contains saponin and vitamins good for the treatment of cancer and other diseases.
					
					 Some of its ingredients supply oxygen and nutritive substances to brain cells to improve cerebration.
					
					 Bean sprout also helps kill cold virus and toxicity of alcohol.
					
					 Methionine and other ingredients good for liver keep skin fair and vitamin A and C and amino acids prevent constipation.
					
					 Bean sprout is also proved to be efficacious for hypertension, arteriosclerosis and hypotension.

articles.title: Model Machine Movement
articles.content:
Model Machine Movement 
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Fifty years has elapsed since the model machine movement was launched in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The mass movement is aimed to encourage all to properly maintain their machines and effectively use them so as to keep their performance going well and boost the production capacity.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il set an example of maintaining machines at the Pyongyang Textile Machine Plant in the spring of Juche 50 (1961).
					
					 The example sparked off the model machine movement in the country, which has become a powerful mass movement propelling socialist construction.
					
					 Some 10,000 workshops and 11,800 industrial establishments won the title of the "Lathe No. 26" Model Machine and some of them the title twice. 890 workshops and 1,600 establishments were awarded the "Lathe No. 26" Model Machine Prize.
					
					 The movement has entered a higher stage as required by the era of the IT-based economy.

articles.title: Burial of Defoliant by US Forces Is Insult to Korean Nation--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Burial of Defoliant by US Forces Is Insult to Korean Nation--Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The burial of defoliant by the GIs in south Korea is a revelation of the United States' arrogance and extreme ethnocentrism and an intolerable insult to the Korean nation.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					 The U.S. troops in south Korea sprayed large amounts of defoliant in the Demilitarized Zone along the Military Demarcation Line from the late 1960s to the early 1970s. This is the hideous crime that can be committed by barbarians engrossed in national chauvinism and misanthropy, the paper says, adding:
					
					 It is needless to say that the U.S. imperialists leave no stone unturned to attain their criminal aims.
					
					 It has been confirmed again through the burial of defoliant that the situation can never be eased nor environmental pollution prevented in the Korean Peninsula as long as the U.S. imperialist aggression forces, the root cause of war, are stationed in south Korea.
					
					 Clean environment can be provided through disposal of filth. The vile U.S. forces should be driven out of south Korea as they regard it as nothing but a dumping ground and a place for toxic materials disposal and take no account of the safety of the Korean nation.
					
					  Only then, is it possible to prevent environment pollution and outbreak of war on the peninsula and ensure the safety of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Minju Joson Assails US Strategy for Military Hegemony
articles.content:
Minju Joson Assails US Strategy for Military Hegemony
Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The United States is now making hullabaloo after putting GEO-1, an ultramodern spy satellite, into orbit to replace DSP which the U.S. Department of Defense operated for 30 years. It plans to launch three more similar satellites till 2016.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 The U.S. claims this spy satellite is a shield for beating back the missile attack from the DPRK, but this is nothing but a poor trick to cover up the criminal purpose of its missile shield and escape the international community's criticism.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. is dreaming of establishing an unchallenged domination over the world and seeking a main link in its chain efforts to carry out its strategy for world domination in the unchallenged military edge.
					
					 This is clearly evidenced by the fact that the U.S. has gone ahead with the deployment of its missile shield in Europe defying the opposition of Russia and, consequently, the U.S.-Russia contradictions and conflict are festering.
					
					 With no rhetoric can the U.S. justify its moves to build missile shields, a product of the strategy for world domination, and hide its true colors as the criminal that threatened the world with an arms race and nuclear war.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to drop its bad habit of seeking its despicable interests by finding fault with others and roll back at once its criminal strategy for military hegemony which will only bring misfortune to humankind.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Decisively Foiling S. Korean Warmongers' Provocations
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Decisively Foiling S. Korean Warmongers' Provocations
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The desire of the fellow countrymen for reunification is now chilled by a handful of south Korean confrontation maniacs and the danger of a war is increasing as the days go by. This grave situation calls for decisively shattering the reckless provocations of the puppet group against the DPRK, factors of escalating the confrontation and tensions on the Korean Peninsula.   Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a by-lined article.
					 Provocations against the DPRK have been an inveterate bad habit for the successive south Korean conservative groups, the article notes, citing fact to prove the fact.
					
					 Recalling that the above-said provocations have been intensified since the appearance of the Lee Myung Bak conservative regime, the article continues:
					
					 The Lee group has become frantic with its psychological warfare, massively scattering into areas of the northern half of Korea leaflets malignantly slandering its ideology and system. This is nothing but politically motivated provocations that can be seen only on the eve of a war.
					
					 The puppet warmongers fabricated the "Cheonan" warship sinking case and the Yonphyong Island shelling incident in the West Sea of Korea last year. These were hideous provocations as they pushed the inter-Korean relations to an extreme phase and drove the situation on the peninsula to a touch-and-go situation.
					
					 The recent hideous provocation perpetrated by the Lee group of traitors is part of its anti-DPRK rackets and its height.
					
					 There were ceaseless political and military provocations of south Korea against the DPRK but the recent case in which the supreme dignity of the DPRK was hurt was something unprecedented. The above-said reckless provocation of the Lee group could be committed only by confrontation maniacs bereft of any reason and hooligans ignorant of elementary ethics and morality.
					
					 It makes no sense to allow the confrontation maniacs to remain at large while hurting the supreme dignity of the DPRK, not content with madcap saber-rattling to do harm to it by force of arms.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors' Hideous Provocation Blasted
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors' Hideous Provocation Blasted
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group committed such unprecedentedly hideous provocation as daring hurt the supreme dignity of the DPRK. This fully disclosed its true colors as maniacs for confrontation with fellow countrymen putting into the shade the successive fascist ruling quarters and as a group of hooligans bereft of any elementary ethics and morality. 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes this in a by-lined commentary:
					
					 The above-said crime is the worst of all what the group has committed against the nation so far. 
					
					 The DPRK has so far warned the group of the serious consequences to be entailed by its moves to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen and ignite a war and persuaded it enough to come to understanding. Nevertheless, the group was so hell-bent on such confrontation that it made no scruple of committing such hideous provocation as daring hurt the DPRK's supreme dignity, defying its repeated warnings. How can the nation forgive such crime? Just as a mad dog is fated to be beaten to death with a stick, there is no other way but to mercilessly punish the group by force of arms as mere warning is not enough to make it come to its senses. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will escalate their practical and overall military retaliation till the puppet authorities have taken measures to punish the prime movers of the case and make apology for it. 
					
					 The puppet authorities should promptly take measures to severely punish the prime movers of the worst crime committed against the nation, make a formal apology for it and give official assurances against the recurrence of the similar case. This is the only solution to the issue, concludes the commentary.

articles.title: Actions to Hold 6. 15 National Meeting for Peace and Reunification Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions to Hold 6. 15 National Meeting for Peace and Reunification Called for in S. Korea
Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) on June 2 issued a statement titled "Let's hold June 15 national meeting for peace and reunification without fail ".
					 The statement recalled that the South, North and Overseas Sides Committees for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration agreed to hold with splendor the June 15 national meeting for peace and reunification in Kaesong on June 15 on the occasion of the 11th anniversary of the joint declaration.
					
					 The South Headquarters of Pomminryon fully supports and approves this agreement out of patriotism, the statement noted, and went on:
					
					 The group of traitors can never be pardoned for such treachery as hurting the nation.
					
					 It called upon all the fellow countrymen to struggle against Lee Myung Bak, hold the national meeting without fail and demonstrate once again the might of the spirit "By the Korean nation itself".
					
					 The South Headquarters of Pomminryon will take the lead in the struggle to open a new phase of independent reunification, it stressed.

articles.title: Traitor Lee Myung Bak Accused of Appointing Ministers in Dictatorial Manner
articles.content:
Traitor Lee Myung Bak Accused of Appointing Ministers in Dictatorial Manner
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea in a commentary on June 2 accused traitor Lee Myung Bak of appointing ministers in a dictatorial manner. 
					 The commentary recalled that Lee held a ceremony of awarding writs of appointment to five candidates for new ministers defying the opposition of different circles.
					
					 To appoint as ministers those who got failing marks from the people due to lack of morality and professional knowledge is little short of the behavior of Lee who disregarded the warning served by the people in the past by-election, it charged.
					
					 Lee's forces should bear in mind that no matter how noisily they may talk about the people's living, they would not pin any hope on them any longer.

articles.title: Human Rights Abuses against Reunification Champion Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Human Rights Abuses against Reunification Champion Slammed in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- South Korean Christians and members of the Solidarity for Progress staged a protest in front of Seoul prison on June 2 against the authorities' violation of rights of Rev. Han Sang Ryol, a reunification champion.
					 They accused the prison authorities of putting Rev. Han to all sorts of persecution in a solitary prison cell encircled by steel net. 
					
					 This should be halted at once as it is a serious human right abuse, they demanded.

articles.title: Actions for Punishing Present Regime Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions for Punishing Present Regime Called for in S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally in Seoul on June 3 at which it called for turning out in the actions to punish the present regime in order to build a society where the workers have become its masters.
					 Speakers at the rally strongly denounced the authorities for hurling police forces to suppress the strike of workers of the Yusong Enterprise demanding the guarantee of vital rights.
					
					 Such suppression is aimed at calming down the fighting sprit of the workers, they charged.
					
					 No matter what brutal crackdown the authorities resort to, the workers will stage dynamic actions to win vital rights such as the hike of minimum wages and total revision of the Law on Trade Unions, they warned.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Bangladeshi Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Bangladeshi Figures
						
Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Personages of Bangladesh issued statements on June 1 to mark the 47th anniversary of the start of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work at the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, said in a statement that Kim Jong Il, who set it as his lifelong task to strengthen the WPK into the party of President Kim Il Sung, clarified the philosophy that a revolutionary party is in essence the party of a leader and this political organization serves for carrying into practice the idea and guidance of a leader.
					
					 He has turned dignified Kim Il Sung's Korea into an invincible socialist bulwark, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence while wisely leading the human cause of justice for independence against imperialism and for global peace, the statement said, adding that his undying feats would shine for all ages.
					
					 Hasanul Huq Inu, chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, in a statement said that the past 47 years since Kim Jong Il started his work at the C.C., the WPK were the shining days in which the great history of defending socialism and building a thriving nation was ushered in the DPRK.
					
					 Under his guidance the WPK could turn into a powerful party with the steadfast stand of independence that does never waver in any storm and stress of history, the chairman stressed.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Successful Unofficial Visit to China Hailed
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Successful Unofficial Visit to China Hailed 
						
Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo, chairman of the Central Committee of the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, issued a statement on June 1 hailing the successful unofficial visit paid by General Secretary Kim Jong Il to the People's Republic of China.
					 The statement said that the news of his visit to China is evoking a lively response among the political and social circles of the world. 
					
					  It went on:
					
					 The warm welcome and cordial hospitality accorded by the Chinese party and state leaders to Kim Jong Il was a manifestation of their profound respect and reverence for him who has made tireless efforts to boost the DPRK-China friendship and develop the world socialist movement.  
					
					 His China visit marked a historic event that made a great contribution to developing the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries on a higher stage as required by the new century, protecting the peace and security in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world and achieving their prosperity. 
					
					 His historic visit to China will be brilliantly recorded in the history of the DPRK-China friendship.
					
					 All the members of the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico express belief that the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people will wage a dynamic all-out offensive for this year to commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung as the greatest auspicious event in human history under the experienced and seasoned leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: 6. 15 North-South Joint Declaration Hailed in Myanmar
articles.content:
6. 15 North-South Joint Declaration Hailed in Myanmar
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Tin Tun, director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, issued a statement on June 3 on the occasion of the 11th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration. 
					 The statement said that the joint declaration is a landmark of Korea's reunification reflecting the will and desire of all the Korean people. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					The birth of the June 15 era of reunification clearly proves that General Secretary Kim Jong Il is the father of the Korean nation and the loadstar of independent reunification.
					
					 Since then, the Korean people's will to achieve independent reunification has been more clearly proved and the history of Korea's reunification has advanced dynamically under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The Korean people enshrine high national pride and self-respect as they are holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as a great leader and are firmly convinced that the cause of Korea's reunification is sure to be accomplished only when they advance along the road indicated by him. 
					
					 The statement expressed belief that the Korean people would wage a dynamic struggle for achieving the country's independent and peaceful reunification under the banner of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and thus fully demonstrate the might of reunified Korea in the near future.

articles.title: Decision to Convene World Conference on Juche Idea Hailed in Nepal
articles.content:
Decision to Convene World Conference on Juche Idea Hailed in Nepal
						
Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The Study Forum for Self-Reliance of Nepal issued a statement on June 1 in support of the decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the International Institute of the Juche Idea.
					 The statement said:
					
					 We fully support the decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the International Institute of the Juche Idea to convene the world conference on the Juche idea in Pyongyang, the DPRK, the founding-state of the Juche idea, in April, 2012 to commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung as a grand political festival of humankind.
					
					 We decided to hold colorful political and cultural events on this occasion.
					
					 The Juche idea followers of Nepal extend firm solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to open the gate to a thriving nation without fail and reunify the country independently and peacefully under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Chinese Premier Calls for Stronger Efforts to Combat Drought
articles.content:
Chinese Premier Calls for Stronger Efforts to Combat Drought
						
 Beijing, June 5 (KCNA) -- Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao called for stronger efforts to combat drought at a seminar in Wuhan, capital city of central Hubei Province, on Saturday for drought relief work in 5 provinces in the Yangtze River basin.
					 He said that conducting effective drought relief work is critical for the stable development of food and agriculture as well as steadily boosting rural incomes.
					
					 The drought relief work is important for the country to maintain stable and rapid economic growth, he added.
					
					 He urged the drought-hit provinces and related authorities to overcome the adverse impacts of the drought and to take a scientific approach to cope with the disaster.

articles.title: Chinese Paper on Increased US Forces' Deployment in Korea
articles.content:
Chinese Paper on Increased US Forces' Deployment in Korea 
						
 Beijing, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Chinese paper Shijie Xinwenbao on May 17 carried an article titled "The U.S. readjusting its strategic deployment targeting China".
					 It said under its sub-title "The U.S. is increasing its forces' deployment and it may use its old method again" that the U.S. and south Korea are planning to stage many military exercises in the regions where situation remains tense. 
					
					 VOA on May 10 reported that the U.S. military said it would stage joint military exercises with U.S. and south Korean marine corps involved as part of the plan. It was reported that the exercises would be conducted on the island where shelling was exchanged between the DPRK and south Korea last year. 
					
					 Hong Lei, a spokesman for the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, on April 21 said that the Chinese side called on all parties concerned to show their flexibilities and do many things helpful to relaxing the situation so as to provide conditions for resuming the six-party talks.
					
					 Since the earthquake in Japan and the leakage of nuclear substances the trend of economic fusion in East Asia has become more distinct than ever before. 
					
					 It is our view that the U.S. should not cause another trouble on the Korean Peninsula at this time. 
					
					 The issue of the Korean Peninsula today has already become another important checker in disturbing the economic cooperation in East Asia and the U.S. Congress may further deteriorate situation there if necessary. 
					
					 As the U.S. is pouring a lot of more military and political resources into the peninsula at present, it may cook up any new case if necessary in a bid to get rid of its predicament in this region. 
					
					 We required to be highly vigilant against "what flowers and fruits" the seeds sown by the U.S. in south Korea through the joint military exercises will "yield."

articles.title: Chinese Paper on Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
Chinese Paper on Inter-Korean Relations
						
 Beijing, June 5 (KCNA) -- The chief of the Center for Korean Peninsula Studies of the Asia-Pacific Institute under the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences said that the relations between the north and the south of Korea are national ties, according to the Chinese People's Daily on June 2.
					 One may say north Korea has generally maintained its consistency in its policy towards the inter-Korean relations. The north and the south differ in their social systems. South Korea changed its policy whenever regime change took place. But north Korea has maintained one principle.
					
					 There has been no success to speak of in the inter-Korean relations over the past few years since Lee Myung Bak came to power. 
					
					 The paper on June 1 reported as follows:
					
					  North Korea attempted to improve the inter-Korean relations by taking measures on its own initiative at the outset of the year. It proposed south Korea to have a series of dialogue including talks between authorities, Red Cross talks and military talks.
					
					 South Korea, however, has persistently slandered north Korea and put military pressure on it.
					
					North Korea has gradually begun taking a tough attitude and on May 30 declared an important decision including the severance of contact with the south Korean "government".

articles.title: China's Measure to Develop Education of Preschool Children
articles.content:
China's Measure to Develop Education of Preschool Children
 Beijing, June 5 (KCNA) -- Hubei Province, China is channeling efforts into developing the education of preschool children.
					 In accordance with the plan, the province will renovate or rebuild on an expansion basis 1,500 kindergartens till 2013.
					
					 And it will train, at the same time, more than 30,000 kindergarten teachers.

articles.title: Prime Minster's Resignation Urged in Japan
articles.content:
Prime Minster's Resignation Urged in Japan
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Japanese of different social standings are raising their voice in demand of the present prime minister's resignation.
					 Former Prime Minister Hatoyama at the prime ministerial residence on May 31 asked Naoto Kan to step down.
					
					 Earlier on May 30, the vice-president of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan told reporters that it is the public opinion to replace the prime minister. The prime minister should seriously accept this, he added.

articles.title: Lao Deputy PM Highlights Importance of Children's Health
articles.content:
Lao Deputy PM Highlights Importance of Children's Health 
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The Lao deputy prime minister and concurrently minister of Foreign Affairs highlighted the importance of children's health. He said this in a speech on Wednesday on the occasion of the International Children's Day.
					 It is an important work for the development of the country to bring up children healthy and well, the minister said.
					
					 The government will pay deep attention to the work for protecting children, the minister added.

articles.title: General Assembly of Latin American News Agencies
articles.content:
General Assembly of Latin American News Agencies
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The first general assembly of the Latin American Union of News Agencies was held in Venezuela on June 2 and 3.
					 Present there were directors of the news agencies of Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Cuba, Ecuador, Mexico, Guatemala, Paraguay and Venezuela.
					
					 The assembly discussed such issues as organizational structure, statutes and operations of the union.
					
					 The union will give publicity to the Latin American view and achievements made in the struggle for social justice.

articles.title: Iran Ready to Beat back US Attack--Iranian Defence Minister
articles.content:
Iran Ready to Beat back US Attack--Iranian Defence Minister
 Teheran, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Iranian army is fully ready to beat back any attack by the U.S., the minister of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics of Iran said this at a press conference on June 1.
					 The U.S. which suffered setbacks in Iraq and Afghanistan dares not attack Iran, the minister noted, adding:
					
					 The U.S. has often used sanctions as a lever for provoking sovereign states. This, however, betrays its vulnerability and baseness.

articles.title: Iran Slams Foreign Forces' Presence in Afghanistan
articles.content:
Iran Slams Foreign Forces' Presence in Afghanistan
						
 Tehran, June 5 (KCNA) -- Iran's deputy foreign minister said that foreign forces in Afghanistan undermine the stability and security of Afghanistan as well as the region.
					 At a meeting with the UN envoy to Afghanistan on June 1, he said that all foreign forces should be withdrawn from Afghanistan at an early date.

articles.title: Most Australians Want Troops in Afghanistan Home
articles.content:
Most Australians Want Troops in Afghanistan Home
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Australians are getting tired and sick with the U.S. "anti-terrorism war".
					 A study conducted by the U.S. Studies Center at Australia's University of Sydney on Wednesday and Thursday found 63 percent of Australian respondents think the war on terrorism will never end.
					
					 It found 62 percent of people want to see all Australian troops home.

articles.title: More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
articles.content:
More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- More NATO soldiers in Afghanistan met deaths by the attack of the resistance forces of this country.
					 Five NATO soldiers were killed Friday and Saturday in the insurgent attacks in the southern and eastern Afghanistan regions.

articles.title: More Pakistanis Killed in US Drone Strike
articles.content:
More Pakistanis Killed in US Drone Strike
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan are continuing killing of Pakistanis under the pretext of "anti-terrorism".
					 At least seven people were killed in a U.S. drone strike launched late Friday night in Pakistan's northwest tribal area of South Waziristan.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim entiende labor económica de provincia de Ryanggang
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim entiende labor económica de provincia de Ryanggang
Pyongyang, 7 de junio (ATCC) -- El premier del Consejo de Ministros Choe Yong Rim estudió en el terreno desde el día 2 hasta el 4 la labor económica de la provincia de Ryanggang.
					  Choe recorrió la Fábrica de Acero de Hyesan, la Fábrica de Calzados de Hyesan, la Granja- Invernadero de Verduras de Samjiyon, la Empresa de Arándano Juventud de Paektusan, la Fábrica de Elaboración de Patata de Taehongdan, la granja de la zona de Tokpho del distrito de Paek-am y otras unidades de producción y órganos del servicio gastronómico comercial y social para estudiar detalladamente del estado de de producción y reconstrucción técnica, de administración y gestión.
					
					  En la reunión consultiva de los funcionarios de las ramas relacionadas él hizo la labor práctica para movilizar al máximo as materias primas de las zonas montañosas en las fábricas industriales locales conforme al propósito del partido, aumentar en gran escala la superficie de patatal y activar la labor económica de la provincia.
					
					  El día 3, el premier recorrió el campo de construcción de la Central Hidroeléctrica Juventud Songun de Paektusan y tomó las medidas para resolver satisfactoriamente los problemas que se presentan en aumentar la producción eléctrica de la central no. 1 inaugurada con anticipación y dar acicate a la obra de dique.

articles.title: Pueblo coreano jura vengarse de la banda de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Pueblo coreano jura vengarse de la banda de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 7 de junio (ATCC) -- Informados de la reciente declaración del portavoz del Estado Mayor General del Ejército Popular de Corea (EPC), los habitantes de diferentes sectores de la República Popular Democrática de Corea están jurando montados en odio y cólera la venganza contra la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak que insultó la máxima dignidad de la RPDC que significa la vida y la bandera para el pueblo coreano.
					El general del EPC Kim Chol dijo a la ATCC que el EPC entrará en las acciones de represalia militar real y total para aniquilar de una vez a la banda de traidores surcoreanos y las intensificará gradualmente hasta que ésta tome las medidas de castigar a los autores principales del presente caso y pedir perdón.
					
					El primer secretario del Comité Central de la Unión de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, Ri Yong Chol, declaró que los jóvenes coreanos están en la disposición de exterminar implacablemente a los aborrecibles traidores surcoreanos, siendo fusiles y bombas en defender a la Dirección de la Revolución a costa de la vida.
					
					El gerente del Complejo Siderúrgico Kim Chaek, Ri Hi Hon, destacó que si llega el momento de batalla de vida o muerte, los miembros de la Guardia Roja Obrero-Campesina de su complejo liquidarán a los enemigos al frente de avance y reducirán a cenizas el foco de confrontación fratricida.
					
					El presidente del Comité Central de la Unión de Trabajadores Agrícolas de Corea, Ri Myong Gil, recalcó que sus gremiales esperan el momento con el fúsil en una mano y la hoz en la otra para barrer una vez por todas a los connotados enemigos de la nación.
					
					El jefe del Secretariado del CC del Frente Democrático para la Reunificación de la Patria, Kim Wan Su, llamó a todos los coreanos del Norte, el Sur y en ultramar a movilizarse como un solo hombre en la gigantesca lucha por frustrar rotundamente las cada día más brutales campañas conflictivas anti-RPDC de la horda del traidor Lee.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia estrategia de supremacía militar de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia estrategia de supremacía militar de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 7 de junio (ATCC) -- Recientemente, Estados Unidos lanzó a la órbita de nuestro planeta el ultramoderno satélite de exploración "GEO-1", sustituible al DSP operado 30 años por el Departamento de Defensa norteamericano.
					El imperio planea lanzar adicionalmente los 3 satélites de misma serie hasta el año 2016.
					
					EE.UU. dice que esos satélites son escudos para frenar el ataque de misiles de Corea, pero, esto es una artimaña para encubrir el objetivo criminal de su sistema antimisiles y evadir las censuras de la sociedad internacional. 
					
					Señala el periódico Minju Joson en un comentario individual de este martes y prosigue:
					
					Ahora EE.UU. pretende establecer el dominio monopolizado sobre el mundo y considera que lo fundamental para realizar esta estrategia de domino reside en la supremacía militar absoluta.
					
					Lo muestra el hecho de que EE.UU. promueve el establecimiento del sistema antimisiles en Europa pese al rechazo de Rusia, debido a lo cual se agravan el antagonismo y la discordia entre los dos países. 
					
					No pueden ser justificadas de ninguna manera las maniobras de EE.UU. tendentes a establecer el sistema antimisiles, producto de la estrategia de supremacía sobre el mundo, ni puede ser ocultada la naturaleza criminal de ese imperio que acarrea al mundo la carrera armamentista y la guerra nuclear. 
					
					EE.UU. debe abandonar su vicio de satisfacer el interés sucio acusando a otros países y su estrategia de supremacía militar de carácter criminal que causará desgracias a la humanidad.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena la provocación de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena la provocación de Lee Myung Bak
						
Pyongyang, 7 de junio (ATCC) -- La camarilla de Lee Myung Bak perpetró sin titubeo la provocación que ofenda la máxima dignidad de la República Popular Democrática de Corea, lo cual demostró a todo el mundo la naturaleza de los maniacos conflictivos que superan a los ex-dominantes fascistas y de los gángsteres que no saben la elemental moralidad.
					Señala el periódico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este martes y continúa:
					
					Tal provocación es el crimen más grave cometido ante la nación.
					
					Hasta la fecha, la RPDC advirtió a la camarilla de Lee la grave consecuencia que emane de las maquinaciones de enfrentamiento y de guerra y la persuadió tanto. Pero, enloquecida por la confrontación fratricida, ella cometió sin titubeo la tremenda provocación que ofenda la máxima dignidad de la RPDC menospreciando repetidas advertencias de ésta.
					
					El ejército y el pueblo de Corea intensificarán gradualmente las acciones de venganza militar real y total hasta que las autoridades títeres tomen las medidas para castigar a los autores principales del caso y pedir perdón.
					
					El remedio de resolución del problema es que las autoridades títeres surcoreanas deben tomar las medidas arriba mencionadas y disculparse oficialmente ante toda la nación por su provocación de máxima gravedad y garantizar de igual manera la prevención de repetición.
